Key Match Events: SIX! Asitha Fernando to Evin Lewis. Length ball, down leg side on the front foot Slog, well timed in the air under control over long off for 6 runs.
Asitha Fernando to Sherfane Rutherford. Half volley, down leg side on the front foot working, to deep mid wicket for 1 run, fielded by Fernando.
SIX! Asitha Fernando to Sherfane Rutherford. Full toss, down leg side backing away Slog, well timed in the air under control over long on for 6 runs.
Asitha Fernando to Sherfane Rutherford. Length ball, down leg side backing away driving, well timed to deep cover for 2 runs, fielded by Mendis.
Asitha Fernando to Sherfane Rutherford. Half volley, to leg on the front foot defending, back to bowler for no runs.
Asitha Fernando to Evin Lewis. Half volley, middle stump on the front foot pushing, to long off for 1 run, fielded by de Silva.
Dilshan Madushanka to Evin Lewis. Reverse Swing-In full toss, off stump on the front foot driving, to long off for 1 run, fielded by de Silva.
SIX! Dilshan Madushanka to Evin Lewis. Length ball, outside off stump on the front foot Slog, well timed in the air under control over long on for 6 runs.
Dilshan Madushanka to Sherfane Rutherford. Half volley, off stump on the front foot defending, inside edge to square leg for 1 run, fielded by Vimukthi.
Dilshan Madushanka to Sherfane Rutherford. Reverse Swing-In yorker, middle stump on the front foot defending, back to bowler for no runs.
Pre-Game Insights: The ICC Test Championship sees nine teams compete across a two-year cycle of matches before a two-team final decides the winner. The inaugural competition was won by New Zealand after a thrilling victory over India in June 2021.

The 50-over World Cup is far older and has been competed for since back in 1975. Australia are the record winners having run out victorious on five occasions (1987, 1999, 2003, 2007 and 2015). England took the 2019 crown after a dramatic Ben Stokes-inspired super-over win over New Zealand at Lord's.

The shortest form of the game sees teams compete in Twenty20. The newest format has been an instant global hit with a number of hugely-lucrative competitions massively popular all over the world. Australia are reigning world champions having taken victory in the 2021 tournament.
